To the scoreboard
end of pbp; rest deduced
$US Vice President Charles Dawes attended the game
$Hal Wiltse struck on the stomach by the ball; carried off the field
$HP umpire Harry Geisel would not allow George Sisler to use his regular bat because it had a slight coating of tar
$HP umpire Harry Geisel would not allow Bill Barrett to use his regular bat; the bat was discolored but had no tar on it; the two argued for several minutes but Barrett's bat was ruled illegal
$Harry Rice called for interference for running into his own batted ball
$HP umpire Harry Geisel would not allow Bill Hunnefield to use his regular bat
$Ted Lyons failed to advance on the grounder and Alex Metzler was trapped
pbp account ends here. Rest deduced
ej,schar103,M,owenb901,Fair/foul call White Sox Manager Ray Schalk ejected by HP umpire Brick Owens sometime in game
$Johnny Hodapp injured his foot sliding into 2B
30 minute rain delay
$Aaron Ward and Bobby Reeves collided; Ward injured
$Roger Peckinpaugh and Bobby Reeves collided
$Ray Schalk Julie Wera collided; Schalk suffered injured nose and dislocated shoulder
$Bill Hunnefield waited to see if the ball would be caught
$Julie Wera left with a charley horse
$over the roof of the double-decked RF stands
$Max Bishop rounded 3B too far
$Chick Galloway rounded 1B too far

$Goose Goslin complained to HP umpire Brick Owens that Ted Lyons was taking too long to wind up, and stepped out of the batters box; when Goslin refused to step back in, Owens told Lyons to pitch; the ball was called strike three
$Rube Lutzke rounded 2B too far
$game called for darkness
$game called due to darkness
